feed.title: Google Cloud: Colab Enterprise
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Colab Enterprise

entry.content:
Visualization cells

Preview: You can use visualization cells to generate interactive and editable visualizations from within a Colab Enterprise notebook. You can configure the chart type, aggregation, colors, labels, and other aspects of the visualization to help you explore data and discover insights. For more information, see Use visualization cells.
entry.summary: Create interactive and editable visualizations directly within your Colab Enterprise notebooks. Customize chart types, colors, and labels to explore data and uncover insights.
entry.title: Feature: Interactive Visualizations in Colab Enterprise

entry.content:
SQL cells

Preview: You can use SQL cells to write, edit, and run SQL queries directly from your Colab Enterprise notebooks. For more information, see Use SQL cells.
entry.summary: Write, edit, and run SQL queries directly within your Colab Enterprise notebooks using the new SQL cells feature.
entry.title: Feature: SQL Cells in Colab Enterprise

entry.content:
Post-startup scripts

Preview: You can use a post-startup script to perform tasks after the startup process of your Colab Enterprise runtime. For example, you can use a post-startup script to install specific packages or make specific changes to your runtime's VM. For more information, see Use a post-startup script.
entry.summary: You can now use post-startup scripts to customize your Colab Enterprise runtime after it starts, for tasks like installing packages or modifying the VM.
entry.title: Feature: Post-startup scripts available

entry.content: Generally available: You can consume reservations with Colab Enterprise runtimes. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your runtimes have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see Use reservations with Colab Enterprise.
entry.summary: You can now use reservations with Colab Enterprise runtimes to ensure your runtimes have the resources they need.
entry.title: Feature: Colab Enterprise now supports reservations

entry.content: You can now use the new Data Science Agent to automate exploratory data analysis, perform machine learning tasks, and deliver insights from within a Colab Enterprise notebook. To get started, see Use the Data Science Agent. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Automate your data analysis and machine learning tasks with the new Data Science Agent in Colab Enterprise.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Science Agent Available

entry.content: Preview: You can consume reservations with Colab Enterprise runtimes. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your runtimes have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see Use reservations with Colab Enterprise.
entry.summary: Colab Enterprise runtimes can now use reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources. This provides a higher level of assurance that your runtimes will have the necessary resources to run.
entry.title: Feature: Colab Enterprise now supports reservations

entry.content: Python 3.11 is now available in Colab Enterprise. Existing runtimes and runtime templates will remain using Python 3.10. For more information, see Python versions.
entry.summary: Python 3.11 is now available for use in Colab Enterprise. However, please note that existing runtimes and templates will continue to use Python 3.10.
entry.title: Feature: Python 3.11 Now Available in Colab Enterprise

entry.content:
When you create a runtime template, you can now configure it to use the latest Python version available to Colab Enterprise, or you can specify the Python version. Using Latest is a new option that means when a new version of Python is introduced to Colab Enterprise, runtimes that you create will use the latest Python version.

Existing runtime templates and runtimes remain using their current Python version (Python 3.10). This includes existing auto-generated default runtime templates. To create default runtime templates that use Latest, you must do one of the following:

  • Delete the existing default runtime templates. Then, when a new default runtime template is created, the Python version will be set to Latest.
  • Change a runtime template's Python version by using the REST API.
entry.summary: You can now choose to use the latest available Python version for your Colab Enterprise runtimes or specify a particular version. Runtimes using the "Latest" option will automatically update to the newest Python version when it becomes available. Existing runtimes will continue to use their current Python version.
entry.title: Feature: New Python version options for runtimes
